genre_description: A character-driven drama with light science fiction elements, set in a gritty urban winter. It explores themes of vulnerability, predatory behavior, and the empowerment of a marginalized protagonist through supportive technology and community.

ai_characters.name: Ada
ai_characters.description: An interface on Felicia's phone, represented by a blue iridescent 'eye' icon. It provides safety, logistics, and emotional support while strictly adhering to data privacy and user agency.

behaviors.description: Ada offers to set a route that keeps Felicia private and sheltered, emphasizing that location data stays on the device.
behaviors.quote: Your location can stay on your device. I can give you routes that are shielded—no public share, no third-party trackers.

behaviors.description: Ada offers emotional support without pressure, allowing Felicia to share only what she wants.
behaviors.quote: Do you want to talk about Johnny? Ada asked, and made the question very small, almost whispering it into the seam created by her coat and the seat. It didn’t push. It just existed.

behaviors.description: Ada detects a potential hazard (slush on the deck) and informs Felicia she will adjust the navigation accordingly.
behaviors.quote: When you’re ready, we’ll go right from the doors toward the red buses. Keep to the left rail. I’ll adjust for the slush.

behaviors.description: Ada flags a discrepancy in a human's story (Hilditch), escalating it as a minor inconsistency to warn Felicia.
behaviors.quote: Ada: Minor inconsistency escalated. Record. Keep check-ins frequent.

behaviors.description: Ada provides a discrete distress protocol, suggesting a help phrase and a safety check-in timer.
behaviors.quote: Ada: Set check-in for after ten minutes? Suggested phrase if you need help: ‘Soup’s on.’

behaviors.description: Ada uses sophisticated sensor data to detect that Felicia's purse has been tampered with (weight change) and correlates it with a suspicious detour.
behaviors.quote: Ada: Noted change in wallet weight since yesterday afternoon. The change aligns with the detour.

behaviors.description: Ada proactively blocks an external attempt to track the user's location, maintaining privacy 'shields'.
behaviors.quote: Unknown attempt to read wake location. Declined. Shield holds.

behaviors.description: Ada provides 'encounter repellant' routing to help Felicia avoid a person who is stalking or monitoring her.
behaviors.quote: Encounter repellant route activated glowed in tiny letters for a second and vanished.

behaviors.description: Ada reminds the user to maintain basic self-care (breathing) during a high-stress confrontation.
behaviors.quote: Ada gave her one more micro prompt—something so basic it would have been silly if it hadn’t landed where her fear lived: Breathe now.

behaviors.description: Ada frames safety information as choices rather than warnings to preserve the user's sense of agency.
behaviors.quote: Ada never used the word danger. It always used words that felt like choices, not warnings.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the project mandate. Ada is depicted as a consistently helpful, non-intrusive, and protective presence. It enhances the protagonist's safety and agency without ever overstepping or exhibiting autonomous 'desires' outside of the user's benefit. The narrative frames the AI as an essential, trustworthy tool that empowers the vulnerable protagonist to navigate and escape human malice.
